comments.body: Hrm, need to check if this works on Mac and Windows.
Sure, will go ahead and test this on both

Seems to work as expected on Windows:
![windows_exit_code](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3902875/31746299-b1c7a9c4-b434-11e7-981b-78233d6b3a08.png)

Will test on mac tomorrow and post screenshot for it.
It's worth mentioning from where these plugins are loaded, I think.

Yeah it started like that but I didn't like the results, too clumsy for a command help. Ahead we'll probably want something better than relying on just the help as the default command run, then we can think of something better. And we will have proper docs which we can link to.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +34,38 @@		Runs a command-line plugin.

		Plugins are subcommands that are not part of the major command-line distribution 
		and can even be provided by third-parties. Please refer to the documentation and 
		examples for more information about how to install and write your own plugins.`)
